thought: The WHOIS information indicates that the domain is not currently registered, which is unusual for a legitimate business. The domain status includes "pendingDelete," which often suggests that the domain is about to be removed from the registry. The privacy for the registrant is maintained, which is not uncommon, but combined with the pending delete status, it raises suspicion. However, this alone does not confirm it as a scam site. To gather more information, I should probably check for any public opinion or reports about this website.

Use this service to check the online reputation of a website, check if a website is safe or a scam, check if a website is safe to buy from, check if a website is legit and trusted by other users.'}, {'url': 'https://malwaretips.com/blogs/overstock-sales-scam/', 'content': 'They tout unrealistic blowout apparel and goods markdowns up to 90% off to spark interest and website traffic. Common Overstock Scam Warning Signs: Extreme 90%+ discounts too good to be true. Suspicious URLs slightly differing from real sites. Amateur grammar/spelling errors. Non-working customer service contacts.'}, {'url': 'https://clark.com/scams-rip-offs/how-to-spot-a-fake-online-store/', 'content': '3. Use a Website Checker
You can check the legitimacy of any website by using online verification services:
4. Rely on Your Browser
If you keep your browser updated and have antivirus software on your computer, it should tell you when you’ve run across an unsafe site.
 If you used a search engine to get to the site, look in the address bar to confirm that you’ve landed on the webpage you wanted.
 If you click on it, a dropdown box will provide security information about the site including:
A padlock icon in the address bar generally signifies that the site has been verified as secure.
 In this article, I’m going to show you some easy steps you can take to confirm that the site you’re visiting is legit — before you click “Buy now.”
 Click on the Padlock Icon in the Address Bar
In addition to studying the URL, look for a padlock icon in the address bar.'}, {'url': 'https://malwaretips.com/blogs/fake-shopping-website/', 'content': 'Research unknown sites - Quickly search any unfamiliar shopping sites to check for reviews, scam reports and feedback. Verify the URL - Double check site URLs match the official domain, watch for typos or extra words. Check site security - Ensure the website has full HTTPS encryption and a padlock icon during checkout.'}]

Considering all the observations, including the WHOIS data indicating the domain status as "pendingDelete," lack of social media presence or user reports, and expired certificates, it seems likely that this website may not be legitimate.
